title: LOW TOP
body_html:
Filling Pieces is named for the brand’s self described role in the marketplace, namely, filling in the space between streetwear sneakers and high end footwear. The Amsterdam based brand follow in the great Dutch tradition of creating innovative works within a defined structure. Filling Pieces take recognizable, classic silhouettes, simplify them, and then re-imagine them as fashion forward pieces by utilizing high end materials and bold visual elements.

The latest collection from Filling Pieces makes its mark through the use of monochrome and tonal colorways and textured uppers to create a look that is both contemporary and cutting edge and classically stylish at the same time.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: STAN SMITH PK
body_html:
Classic meets contemporary on the Stan Smith OG Primeknit. The Stan Smith is the best selling Adidas model of all time.

We would call this untouchable, but Adidas has brought one of its most successful, modern innovations, Primeknit, to the table, to create a Stan Smith that offers both the enduring casual elegance of the original shoe with the sleek looks and comfort of modern, technological design.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: CT288B
body_html:
New Balance is more commonly known for their legendary running shoes, but, like any well rounded athletic company, they have some court styles up their archival sleeves as well.

If you are looking for New Balance comfort, but aren’t going for the highly cushioned tech of the running range, the CT288B, as a low profile tennis silhouette offers a slimmed down, casual take on the traditional New Balance style.

The Made In England edition makes use of top of the line, traditional construction and premium materials

title: W NYLITE
body_html:
In the US, Tretorn shoes biggest claim to fame is being mentioned by name in 1980’s ‘The Preppy Handbook.’ It’s easy to see why. The simple, canvas/rubber construction and clean lines are the kind of timeless, nonchalant sophistication that light up country club functions across the country.

But if tut-tutting someone for using a four-in-hand knot instead of a Half-Windsor is not now, or in any foreseeable future, one of your priorities, Tretorn still has something to offer.

After all, the legendary Bjorn Borg favored Tretorn shoes, and he was as famed for his icy cool demeanor as he was for being the best tennis player on the planet.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

If silhouettes like the Tubular X and the Tubular Doom are SUVs, the Nova is most assuredly the sports coupe. The low-top silhouette and a streamlined take on the distinctive Tubular sole unit put the Tubular Nova at the forefront of progressive design and contemporary fashion.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: STAN SMITH 999
body_html:
As an historically legendary shoe, a masterpiece of simplicity, and, oh right, the top selling Adidas model of all time, the Stan Smith has earned its place in history.

Giving this classic shoe an original twist without straying from the all-white tennis heritage is a lot to ask, but Adidas proved to be up to the challenge.

The Noble Metals Stan Smith features an ultra-premium leather, but the headline here is in the details. The tongue label and heel tab are not just gold colored, but actually covered in gold leaf, 999 pieces of gold leaf to be exact, courtesy of German goldsmiths Eytzinger. Adidas’s reputation for masterful innovation is well established, but turning a basic, all-white tennis shoe into a bold, elegant fashion statement is a coup, even by their own high standards.

title: ML574NED
body_html:
Generally, New Balance running shoes don’t require an overly elaborate introduction. As performance shoes, they were highly regarded equipment for serious runners. Their sterling reputation gave the classic silhouettes from the New Balance archive a new life in the casual/fashion world.

Running technology is evolving all the time; as a state of the art performance shoe, any given model has a limited amount of time in the spotlight. For a shoe to remain consistently popular after the fact is the hallmark of great design.

The perennial appeal of classic New Balance runners lies in their aesthetic versatility. The tech elements and chunky silhouettes appeal to fans of classic performance shoes while the clean lines and stylish colorways appeal to retro running devotees.

Made in USA

title: NIKE AIR RIFT ANNIVERSARY
body_html:
Natural motion may be one of the leading schools of thought when it comes to running footwear today, but in 1996, running shoes were reaching peak cushioning. When Nike unleashed the Air Rift a minimalist, open topped, split toe shoe inspired by the barefoot runners of Kenya, it was considered, to put it mildly, odd.

2016 marks the Air Rift’s twentieth anniversary. The Rift is a polarizing design to this day, but you don’t reach a milestone like twenty years without some devoted fans; the shoe is definitely a cult classic amongst those with an individualist bent to their style.

Cluttering up the minimalism of the Rift, even to celebrate a milestone, would defeat the purpose of the shoe, so Nike opts to augment the standard construction with a textured suede upper and metallic swoosh on the toe, while a red, green, and black colored insole is a subtle nod to Kenya’s national flag.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out. 

  • Nike Air Rift Anniversary
  • Black/Metallic Silver/White
  • 861532 001

title: SAMBA STARCOW
body_html:
The Samba goes beyond icon status for Adidas; the frozen ground/indoor soccer shoe is a genuine cornerstone of the entire three stripes empire. So, is it possible for a shoe this legendary to be underrated? Yes, actually.

Practically everyone has owned at least one pair of Sambas. The shoe has not only been continuously in production, and there are as many people wearing them for their intended purpose as there are for style. In short, it’s easy to take the eternal reliability of the Samba for granted.

Paris retailer Starcow offers a fashion take on the soccer fixture. Working with such a recognizable silhouette demands that a balance is struck between presenting something novel without obliterating the classic design in the process. This is especially true in the Sabma’s case. One of the keys to the Samba’s enduring popularity is its simplicity, which fits Starcow’s approach here. A napped suede/leather upper in shades of blue is stands out from the familiar black and white colorway, but still feels like an organic part of the shoe’s design.

The Adidas Samba is like a ball-winning, playmaking midfielder who is always in the right place. The Starcow version is like having one of those players available on a free transfer; you’d be foolish to pass it up.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: NIKE ZOOM KD 9
body_html:
The Nike Air Zoom KD9 gives the signature shoe of one of the NBA’s most dynamic players a technological revamp, geared towards KD’s total court coverage playing style. It’s estimated that Durant averages a four mile run, every game, over the course of a season.

The Air Zoom KD9 features a honeycomb structured Flyknit upper is supportive without adding cumbersome bulk, allowing for natural movement of the foot. A full-length Zoom Air sole both cushions the impact of and provides a bounce back response to the taxing variety of foot movement that elite basketball demands.

title: EQUIPMENT RUNNING SUPPORT
body_html:
In the early 90s, the Adidas Equipment range represented a concerted effort to affirm the company’s commitment to cutting edge, high performance, athletic technology. Because the global reach of Adidas had become so encompassing by then, these products were presented under the distinct banner of the Equipment range.

The Equipment Running Support was originally designed to provide responsive support to runners favoring a forefoot strike style, the Equipment Running Support joined an exceedingly long line of Adidas performance running shoes that gained an audience more concerned with the clean lines, lightweight comfort, and stylish colorways than their split times.

title: ULTRABOOST UNCAGED W
body_html:
Adidas develops innovative new running performance technology, the shoes are subsequently, a smash hit, and the shoes become an even bigger deal in the world of style than they are in the world of performance. Stop us if you’ve heard this one before.

Even with the leisurewear and performance markets compartmentalized, it seems like Adidas just can’t help itself when running shoes are involved. The responsive boost cushioning system is the latest bit of Adidas tech to make a name for itself. It isn’t difficult to see why. The boost soles have obvious practical benefits when it comes to running, but the appeal of this kind of lightweight comfort to a wider audience is just as obvious. You don’t need to be a runner to appreciate the minimally sleek, modern design either.

The Ultra Boost Uncaged is a version of the shoe which emphasizes the casual applications. The external support structure has been removed from the shoe, leaving only the knit upper and boost sole to revel in glorious, unfettered minimalism.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: KYRIE 2
body_html:
One thing that stands out about Kyrie Irving’s signature shoe is the use of Arabic, rather than Roman numerals to mark each release. While Roman numerals offer the gravitas of tradition and antiquity, the Kyrie is all about breaking new ground.

Once you actually open the Kyrie 2’s box, there is emphatically more to notice than what kind of numbers are on the outside. The Kyrie 2 offers a number of features that give the shoe a wholly unique visual design. They aren’t merely engineered to play basketball; they are engineered to play basketball the way that Kyrie Irving plays it, which is to say with great speed, razor sharp movements, and pinpoint accuracy. Of course, to perform these marvelous physical feats at speed puts tremendous pressure on the body.

Elements like the curved midsole and outsole, grooved traction-pattern, pivot points, responsive cushioning, and ankle straps are designed to keep the foot secure throughout all of Irving’s electrifying moves on the basketball court.

If you're short on time, you can always just watch the highlights of the 2016 NBA Finals.  Kyrie and his shoes were a major part of why Cleveland''s most recent pro championship no longer predates the moon landing.  

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

Nike Kyrie 2
Black/Reflect Silver
819583 008

body_html:
The Instapump Fury has always been known for doing things entirely its own way. So, there’s no reason for a shoe with a revolutionary design to take the same approach as everyone else to a visual theme.

The “Jungle Gurl” Instapump Fury takes the always popular tropical beach theme, and offers its own twist on it. The Intstapump Fury Jungle Gurl is a visual journey through a tropical landscape. Sunbathing girls, usually the most obvious aspect of any summer sun design, are hidden away in the shoe’s insole, as lush, green, jungle foliage takes center stage on the shoe’s upper, while sandy heel accents lead way to the interior beach scene.

title: CLYDE AWAY
body_html:
For such a basic and iconic shoe, the Puma Clyde/Suede/State has been the subject of some historical confusion regarding its name. The Suede is the shoe’s original moniker. The import models sent to Europe were given the state designation. The ‘Clyde’ comes in thanks to 1970s NBA legend Walt ‘Clyde’ Frazier. The basic Suede was customized to Frazier’s specifications, his signature was affixed to the side of the shoe, and the Clyde was born.

The confusion around this shoe’s name is somewhat ironic, given that there was no mistaking Clyde on or off the court. Frazier’s sense of style set him apart even by the standards of the 1970s. His penchant for wearing wide brimmed hats is what earned him the nickname Clyde, after Bonnie and Clyde, in the first place.

For the first time in five years, Puma is bringing the Clyde back to store shelves.

Available in true blue/white and white/black colorways, the Home and Away Clyde combines the timeless, athletic style of the hardwood with Walt Frazier’s impeccable fashion sense. The old-school looks are presented here in premium materials, with Italian construction to commemorate this legend’s return.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: NIKE AIR MAX BW PREMIUM
body_html:
As would be expected with a global showcase event gathering the world’s elite athletes, shoes have figured prominently in the history of the Olympic games.

With this summer’s games in Rio just around the corner, Nike reaches back into its archive and emerges with some red, white, and blue classics.

The Air Pegasus 92 takes the running workhorse and outfits it in the Nike track & field colorway from that year’s Barcelona games. The vibrant, openness of the host city and the forward looking feeling of a new decade were reflected in the design. The sheen of the the 1980s was traded in for a traditional white, athletic base was augmented by a dark navy blue, intense red, and gold, a perfect choice for the games that would loose the Dream Team upon the world.

The Air Max BW celebrates its twentieth anniversary. Originally released for the 1996 Atlanta games, the dark navy heavy colorway, and chunky tech design are classic Nike and classic 90s. To make matters more interesting, the Air Max BW hasn’t made itself overly available since its initial heyday, so Air Max enthusiasts have an opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a genuine revival.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

Nike Air Max BW Premium 
Black/Crimson/Midnight Navy

title: OG SK8-HI LX
body_html:
The Sk8-Hi's rise to prominence in the skateboarding scene was not complicated. It was a simple, classic Vans silhouette that could withstand the hellish assault that skateboarding dishes out to shoes and ankles. The Vans Vault version is the premium leather edition of this timeless favorite, so maybe stay out of the pools with this one. (Or don’t, we’re not your mother.)

title: X FOOT PATROL PRO KEDS
body_html:
London’s Foot Patrol takes on a true old-school classic in the Pro-Keds Royal Hi. The effortless, simple style of the Pro-Keds basketball silhouette was one of the earliest modern examples of a shoe developing a dedicated street following. The asphalt, outdoor basketball courts and nascent hip-hop culture may be the most commonly cited example of Pro-Keds’ influence, but the Royal’s timeless look transcended associations with one, specific scene.

From the countless fabric houses in the city to the world-famous Saville Row (where the term ‘bespoke’ was coined,) London is no stranger to the cloth trade. Foot Patrol’s interpretation of the Royal Hi pays tribute to this long and influential history.

The ‘Patchwork’ Royal Hi brings together a mix of different patterns, colors, and textiles to give this basketball court classic an offhandedly-elegant makeover. While the Patchwork design serves as a tribute to the creative energies of London’s clothiers, but the diversity of materials and stitched together look also harken back to the Royal’s enduring popularity through so many places and through so much time.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: WMNS LUNAREPIC LOW FLYKNIT ULTD
body_html:
The Olympics are track and field’s greatest showcase. That’s as true for the athletic companies as it is for the runners, so it’s only natural that the producers of performance technology would go all out for the summer games.

The vibrant, backdrop of Rio provides the inspiration for Nike’s 2016 Olympic collection. So much of Nike’s modern, revolutionary outlook on running technology is based on the principle of working in harmony with the natural elements of human physiology. This approach is applied to the visual aspects of the design here; The natural features of tropical insects and birds, bright colors, iridescent feathers and wings, are aligned with the technical innovations that put Nike at the forefront of the running industry.

Elite athletes will be competing in Unlimited Color Flyknit. The LunarEpic Low Flyknit Unlimited brings this concept to the streets. Bodega is proud to be one of the retailers offering limited early access to Nike’s Olympic collection, in celebration of its official unveiling.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: M997CHT
body_html:
Generally, New Balance running shoes don’t require an overly elaborate introduction. As performance shoes, they were highly regarded equipment for serious runners. Their sterling reputation gave the classic silhouettes from the New Balance archive a new life in the casual/fashion world.

Running technology is evolving all the time; as a state of the art performance shoe, any given model has a limited amount of time in the spotlight. For a shoe to remain consistently popular after the fact is the hallmark of great design.

The perennial appeal of classic New Balance runners lies in their aesthetic versatility. The tech elements and chunky silhouettes appeal to fans of classic performance shoes while the clean lines and stylish colorways appeal to retro running devotees.

title: NIKE CORTEZ ULTRA MOIRE
body_html:
One of the reasons the Nike Cortez has been in continuous production for over forty years is that it is a simple and effective shoe. It’s uncomplicated enough to be worn with the same, universal, never out of style ease as a deck shoe, but the running heritage of the Cortez gives it an extra, sporty dimension that you don’t get with the casual icons.

The Cortez Ultra Moire brings some functional updates to this timeless silhouette. The Ultra sole unit features upgraded cushioning, and the seamless, perforated upper construction takes the old-school Cortez from staid to sleek.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: NIKE SOCK DART
body_html:
It’s strange to think that the Sock Dart is a retro release. Originally released back in 2004, the Sock Dart was part of the Nike Free movement’s earliest days. For a shoe that predates the existence of Twitter, the Sock Dart really hasn’t aged much. Even though lightweight knits and seamless uppers are a familiar part of the sneaker landscape, the Sock Dart doesn’t look like a nascent version of modern technology, it still looks like the latest thing off the line.

title: W CL LTHR KLSP
body_html:
Kenrick Lamar returns with another take on a Reebok classic. The Los Angeles rapper continues the visual theme of his previous releases, neutrality between the vivid contrast between red and blue.

With input from Garbstore designer Ian Paley, the latest KL branded effort takes a more visually literal approach to this messaging, with a progressive, deconstructed look. The grey colorway with red and blue accents remains in place, but a visible seam running from the toebox to the tongue serves a physical barrier between the red and blue portions of the shoe.

As a design element not normally seen on a sneaker, the seam serves a reminder that some divisions, as prominent as they are, are entirely man-made.

title: Y-3 QASA HIGH
body_html:
It took a while for the fashion world to notice that the love affair with sneakers went beyond their intended, athletic uses, but once they caught on, the high fashion labels have issued a steady stream of sneakers or ‘sneaker inspired’ silhouettes.

It’s only natural for the actual sneaker companies to try their hand, but if you were expecting a ‘lifestyle’ shoe vaguely reminiscent of an old Samba, think again. What makes the Adidas Y-3 range stand out is its ability to combine the technical manufacturing ability and athletic sensibility with the avant-garde fashion design of Yohji Yamamoto.

title: NIKE ROSHE TIEMPO VI QS
body_html:
The Tiempo is Nike’s classic, leather soccer boot. Since its mid 90s debut, it has graced the feet of luminaries like Romario, Paolo Maldini, Ronaldinho, Carlos Puyol, and Andrea Pirlo, among others. Modern touches like the quilted construction, bright colors, and foot hugging fit keep the technology up to date, but the Tiempo is a through and through classic.

This old-school soccer style comes to the modern minimalism of the Roshe. Despite the apparent, initial differences, the Tiempo is a perfect choice to pair up with the Roshe sole unit. The supple, kangaroo leather upper is a marked departure from the usual lightweight mesh, while the Tiempo’s sleek design and reputation for comfort fit seamlessly into the Roshe concept.

title: X UNITED ARROWS NPC AFF
body_html:
Reebok teams up with United Arrows creative director Motofumi Kogi to put a simple but imaginative twist on a classic tennis silhouette, the NPC.

The uncluttered design of the NPC allows the shoe’s original feel to be inverted by something as simple as a change in color. The light, breezy, immaculate green lawn feel of the traditional white tennis shoe gives way to a sleek, black suede upper with leather detailing. A pink pull tab on the shoe’s heel is a subtle touch that not only adds a color pop to the stark, black and white simplicity, but the pastel shade acts as a wink and nod to the shoe’s preppy heritage.

title: W NIKE ROSHE CORTEZ NM
body_html:
Thanks to their series of collaborations with Nike, the historical roots of textile design firm Liberty have become common knowledge. For the latest Nike x Liberty joint offering, the London clothiers have reached into a part of English history that predates even their own founding, the traditional English garden.

From the pastoral grandeur of the landscape garden to the humble charms of the cottage garden, the English approach to greenery has exerted a massively influential grip on the field for quite a long time, to the point where English garden is essentially interchangeable with idyllic serenity.

Liberty has taken this slice English life into their 2016 collection for Nike. Featuring vachetta leather and a floral print based on a botanical reference illustrations from Liberty’s own, extensive archive, Liberty brings a selection of flowers commonly found in England’s gardens to life in a design that is both bold and delicate, at the same time.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: CHUCK TAYLOR ALL STAR ´70
body_html:
The all-white Chuck Taylor may be the most universally applicable shoe of all time. From starting point of an all-American casual look to being named as the only acceptable sneaker in Ben Weasel’s infamous punk rock dress code, the white Chuck just fits in.

The 1970 edition is Converse’s premium take on the iconic sneaker. A molded sole, reinforced canvas upper, and extra cushioned insole are reasons to buy this classic all over again.

title: Y-3 NOCI0003
body_html:
Yohji Yamamoto, the namesake behind the Adidas Y-3 label has always been known for his uncompromisingly modern, sophisticated, minimalist designs. In 2016, this aesthetic is all the rage, but when Y-3 first appeared on the scene, these shoes, in comparison to both athletic and traditional streetwear design, looked like they had practically come from outer space.

When you’re a trailblazer, once the work you’ve done is recognized as a trail, people eventually start to follow it. So, how can the envelope be pushed any further? In Y-3’s case, they have seized upon the outer space concept as inspiration, rather than a metaphor. Y-3 have created a shoe intended for the on-foot exploration of an alien environment.

The Noci 0003 is an entirely new silhouette which applies the Y-3 principles of high fashion and futurism to a boot. This means multiple closure options, lots of technological performance elements, breathable mesh, elastane, neoprene, tpu heel counters, poron cushioning, and EVA midsoles, combined with leather and suede, all in a thoroughly cutting edge package.

If you’re going to blaze a new trail, you’ll need the right shoes.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: OG ERA LX (CANVAS)
body_html:
The Vans Vault line has made its mark blending timeless Vans style with high end construction and a sharp eye for progressive design. The finished products are a fashion oriented twist on the original Vans spirit.

The latest collection from the Vault opts for a subtle approach. The colorways to be found on this selection of iconic Vans models are the kind of simplicity that harkens back to the brand’s earliest, Southern California storefront days.

While these Vans classics may look purely old school, the classic nylon/vulcanized sole construction is augmented with premium suede and leather detailing. It’s the difference between a skateboard flying around an empty pool, and one hung on the wall like a work of art. Just know, you could still shred in these if you wanted to.

title: AIR FOAMPOSITE ONE
body_html:
The latter half of the 90s was marked, design wise, by a shift towards a bold, futuristic aesthetic.

The Magic inspired black and blue variations are given a rest in favor of a sleek opti-yellow and black colorway. The result is something of a cross between classic Wu-Wear, an ostentatious sports car, and Mortal Kombat 3’s cyborg ninja, Cyrax. In other words, the perfect mix of brash appearance and technological performance that defined the beginning of the new millennium.

title: NIKE AIR ZOOM MERCURIAL XI FK
body_html:
Even with the seemingly endless choice on offer to sneaker fans, long-time enthusiasts will have at least one model that they can only stare covetously at in old photos. Until now, one of those out of reach classics was Nike’s Air Zoom Spiridon.

In anticipation of the shoe’s release later this summer, Nike has brought the distinctive Zoom Air sole unit to the Mercurial Flyknit, as a taste of what’s to come.  You would never guess, especially with the all-white colorway tying everything together, that the Mercurial Flyknit XI draws from a variety of sources. The coming together of Nike’s most popular soccer boot and a Flyknit racing silhouette has already proven to be a successful way to bring the Mercurial into the world of style, and the addition of the Spiridon, full-length Zoom Air sole fits in seamlessly.

title: GEL SIGHT
body_html:
As part of the Gel series, the Gel Sight may look familiar, but the Gel Sight silhouette occupies a unique niche. Originally released only in Japan, the Gel Sight was the official training shoe of athletes prior to the 1992 Summer Olympics in Barcelona, and has only recently found its way out of the Asics archives.

The Gel Sight is a true under the radar gem. The traditional early 90s ‘space shuttle’ silhouette transitions into an angular, almost wedged shaped heel, which prominently features the shoe’s ‘build up’ stabilizing technology.

The Whisper Pink Gel Sight Alpha takes an altogether more leisurely approach to this unearthed classic. Soft neutrals like beige, white, and grey, all in premium suede, compliment a subtle pink upper just in time for all those leisurely summer strolls.

title: JP SIG
body_html:

Maybe because the Chuck Taylor has its roots on the basketball court, while Jack Purcell was famous for his badminton exploits.

The newest Jack Purcell Signature shoe combines the shoe’s timeless, upscale-casual sense of style and its court athletics background. A perforated leather exterior is outfitted with Zoom Air technology and an Ortholite sole, introducing modern comfort to a classic look.

title: NIKE MAYFLY WOVEN
body_html:
The Nike Mayfly, in its original conception was, perhaps, the ultimate performance racing shoe. In the world of competitive running, “seconds count” is more than just a figure of speech, and when mere seconds can make the difference between victory and defeat, or coming just short of a new PR, any chance to shave them off your time is critical.

The Nike Mayfly sought to achieve this through weight reduction. The more weight a runner is carrying, the more effort has to be expended to achieve the same result. The Mayfly eliminated any extra baggage. The parachute nylon upper and minimalist sole were as light as possible. The idea was that wearing the Mayfly in a race after training in your every day shoes would make your normal effort that much more effective.

The original Mayfly’s innovation didn’t stop there. The shoe was designed to last over the course of 100 kilometers, which is why the shoe took its name from an insect with a 24-hour life cycle. Users were supposed to send the shoes back to Nike, where they would be recycled. That part didn’t quite work out as planned. Most people weren’t willing to part with the distinctive yellow and black, tree bark patterned Mayfly, planned obsolescence or not.

Now, the Mayfly is back in a form that the wearer is fully intended to keep for good. The shoe has been reimagined as a lifestyle silhouette. The sleek, minimal shape of the Mayfly is the same, but the lightweight nylon has given way to a woven, suede upper. Some things never change though. You’ll definitely want to keep these long after you’ve eclipsed the 100k mark.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

Nike Mayfly Woven
Jade Glaze/Dust/Summit White
833132 300

title: NIKE W AIR HUARACHE RUN ULTRA
body_html:
There just isn’t much more to say about the Huarache. Since Nike reintroduced the 1991-92 classic, people just can’t seem to get enough of it. So, what else is left?

That’s where the Air Huarache Ultra comes in. This new silhouette is a modernizing overhaul of the original. The familiar shape of the Huarache remains intact, as does the basic concept of the shoe, providing a lightweight, flexible runner that thanks to its snug, fitted construction, is fully supportive. The addition of the Flywire lacing system and an even lighter sole unit bring the Huarache into the modern running fold.

The Air Huarache Ultra combines a classic piece of design with contemporary technology. It’s the perfect reason to start collecting a whole new generation of Huaraches.

title: WMNS NIKE ZOOM ALL OUT FLYKNIT
body_html:
Nike’s LunarEpic Flyknit is currently making waves in the running market as one of the absolute lightest shoes available, thanks to an all-Flyknit upper.

The Flyknit upper’s snug, supportive fit is augmented on Zoom All Out by a compression style sock collar, allowing the Zoom All Out Flyknit to take the ultra-lightweight racing silhouette one step further. Where the LunarEpic Flyknit is equipped with Lunarlon, the Zoom All Out features an eponymous, full length, visible Zoom Air sole, for the maximum amount of responsive cushioning.

While the applications for runners favoring a barely there racing flat are obvious, the Zoom All Out Flyknit stands out stylistically too. The ankle collar offers a visual change of pace from the purely low cut, minimalist Free Run silhouettes, without compromising the overall, ultra-modern aesthetic. The Zoom All Out Flyknit is bound to turn heads, whichever way you wear it.

title: NIKE AIR MAX MERCURIAL '98
body_html:
Before Ronaldo referred to Cristiano, a player who didn’t need more than a single word for the world to know who he was held the mantle. Younger fans who may have only caught the tail end of his career might be unfamiliar with just how dominant the original Ronaldo was at his peak.

Before being ravaged by a devastating pair of knee injuries Ronaldo was the world’s most feared striker. The 1998 UEFA Cup final, where Ronaldo tormented fellow Serie A club Lazio, and an all time great defender in Alessandro Nesta in particular, stands as Il Fenomeno’s signature performance.

The Air Max Mercurial 98 is Nike’s tribute to the cleat that the lethal Brazilian wore while tallying up the majority of his 352 total career goals.  The blue and gold colorway matches the iconic Brazilian soccer kit worn by Ronaldo during the 1998 World Cup in France. The Mercurial’s transfer from grass to asphalt sees the cleats replaced by an Air Max sole unit, and a modernized, Hyperfuse upper.

title: TH-BUFFALO TRAIL LX (LEATHER/NUBUCK/PIG SUEDE)
body_html:
Taka Hayashi doesn’t just reach into the Vans Vault this time, he practically falls through the floor into a secret passageway.

The Buffalo Trail applies Hayashi’s mix of detailed craftsmanship and elegant style and applies it to a long forgotten Vans silhouette, the Vans Serio. Originally a product of Vans’ foray into the performance running shoe market back in the early 80s, the Serio ended up as little more than an experiment.

Although the shoes achieved top of the line quality, Vans were not known for being a running company, and precious few people were willing to make a blind leap into an unfamiliar shoe. Meanwhile, the running silhouette also failed to resonate with traditional Vans enthusiasts.

Nowadays, people are far more willing to stylistically diversify. The Buffalo Trail, quite honestly, does make it easy though. This retro runner incorporates elements of boot construction to combine a classic, high-end, rustic feel with old school athletic style.

title: GEL-LYTE III
body_html:
The most common associations with seersucker are the young and preppy or the “so old fashioned that it looks like they have wondered off of a Tennessee Williams play.” Either way, it comes off a bit stuffy, making the Asics Seersucker Pack a classic juxtaposition of traditional manners and modern sleekness, right?

Not exactly.

Putting the popular, lightweight fabric on tech running shoes like the Gel Lyte III and the Gel Respector is more of a natural fit than it looks. Seersucker is still old fashioned, no question, but before it became the summer wardrobe staple of every burgeoning Colonel Sanders and Quentin Compson, it was the lightweight textile of choice for workers in fields like the railroad and oil industries. The inexpensive, durable, and cooling properties made seersucker ideal for this kind of labor.

It’s true that the Seersucker Pack does give off the familiar casual gentleman about town air, but its practical applications make it a spiritual precursor of sorts to technological advancements like breathable mesh, making it the perfect summer shoe in more ways than one.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: NIKE AIR PENNY II
body_html:
For those who weren’t around during the 90s, it’s difficult to do justice to Penny Hardaway’s rising star power. During the season and a half of Michael Jordan’s first retirement, the NBA, from a marketing perspective, hit a serious snag. The 1993-94 slugfest finals between the Knicks and Rockets left a lot of fans uninspired. Into this uncertain void stepped Penny Hardaway.

His little man-big man pairing with Shaq vaulted the Magic from expansion also-rans to one of the elite teams in the league. Although the 90s Magic never quite made it over the final hill, the NBA had a newly minted superstar, one who naturally had his own signature shoe.  

Penny Hardaway’s signature series for Nike is one of the most successful in the company’s illustrious history. It even threatens to overshadow his impressive on-court career.

The Penny II is one of the most popular and highly regarded models in the series. Now, this 90s classic is back. The curvaceous 90s basketball silhouette and signature Zoom Air cushioning are in full effect here, sporting the same white, black, and royal blue colorway of Orlando’s magic show.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: X WINGS & HORNS MRT580DW
body_html:

To commemorate this shoe’s twentieth anniversary this enduring favorite of a techy trail running shoe has been reworked as a sophisticated casual model with a modern, three piece construction.

The deconstructed upper is assembled from three laser cut pieces: premium leather on the black model and napped suede on the Sand. The whipstitch heel gives the shoe an offhand sophistication, while the neoprene sock liner subtly alludes to the shoe’s running heritage.

Now, the Mayfly is back in a form that the wearer is fully intended to keep for good. The shoe has been reimagined as a lifestyle silhouette. The sleek, minimal shape of the Mayfly is the same, but the lightweight nylon has given way to a woven, suede upper. Some things never change though. You’ll definitely want to keep these long after you’ve eclipsed the 100k mark.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

Nike Mayfly Woven
Tumbled Grey/Anthracite/Summit White
833132 002

title: NIKE PRESTO (GS)
body_html:
Nowadays, the minimalist running movement is everywhere. Seeing a shoe with a lightweight, textile upper, flexible sole, and minimal support structure is no longer a revolutionary experience. It was not always this way. When the Air Presto was originally introduced, everything about the shoe, including the clothing-style small, medium, large, etc. sizing was nothing short of groundbreaking.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

Nike Presto (GS)
Cool Grey/University Red/Black/White
833875 002

title: WORLD BEST
body_html:
The World Best, at first glance, looks like another casual classic from Reebok. It has all the hallmarks: the streamlined, 80s running shape, neutral/primary color scheme, and the microsuede/nylon construction.

Looks can be deceiving. Even though we’re accustomed to thinking of old-school running shoes purely in casual terms, when the World Best originally released in 1987, the shoe was actually one of the lightest runners available. Reebok brings this overlooked gem out of the archive in its original colorway.

Although you can practically see the World Best running across the Fens now, there is one added detail that wasn’t present in 1987. The shoe’s name has been embroidered on the heel, because what’s the point of being the best in the world if nobody knows about it?

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: NIKE AIR TECH CHALLENGE II LSR
body_html:
The Air Tech Challenge radically changed the face of tennis shoe design. The shoe’s debut during the era of Andre Agassi’s acid washed, blonde mulleted glory meant that some especially vivid color palettes were deployed.

NikeLab offers up a subdued, but fashion forward and sophisticated take on the Air Tech Challenge II. An all-tan upper features a mix of suede, nylon, and laser cut leather.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

Nike Air Tech Challenge II Laser
Birch/Birch/White
832647 200

title: NIKE ROSHE DAYBREAK NM
body_html:
Vintage style meets modern comfort, as the upper of the classic 1979 Daybreak running shoe is fitted with a natural motion Roshe sole unit.

The Roshe is such a modern and functional, yet at the same time, timelessly stylish piece of design, that pairing it up with a true, old-school favorite from Nike’s archives is a perfect fit. The end result is so seamless, you’ll swear this shoe has been around for years.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

Nike Roshe Daybreak NM
White/Black/Black/Summit White
826666 100

title: NPCII
body_html:
The Reebok NPC II combines two areas of Reebok’s expertise, old-school heritage and the bold, clean style of an all-white colorway.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: NIKE W DUNK SKY HI ESSENTIAL
body_html:
The Dunk is definitely a shoe that has done well for itself over the years. From being a mainstay on college basketball courts to its second life as a both a skate favorite and a launching board for some of Nike’s most sought after limited releases, the Dunk would have to rank among the most popular silhouettes in the Nike archive.

The Dunk Sky Hi Essential pushes the Dunk into a new area of fashion. This hi-top wedged shape women’s version of the Dunk offers the classic court style in a fashion forward package.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out. 

  • Nike Women's Dunk Sky Hi Essential 
  • Black/Black/Gum Medium Brown/Dark Grey
  • 644877 014

title: NIKE MEADOW '16 TXT
body_html:
Nike may be synonymous with the revolutionary modernization of tennis shoe design, but they weren’t exactly slouches when it comes to the classic tennis shoe either.

The Meadow is an early 80s classic from the Nike archives. The white and blue colorway was a tennis court mainstay for years, and makes the transition to casual style with the precision of an expertly placed lob shot.

In fact, maybe the Meadow is better off now. After all, pretty much any shoe in the world looks better when it isn’t being paired exclusively with white tennis shorts of 1980s tightness.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out. 

  • Nike Meadow '16 TXT
  • White/Photo Blue/Sail
  • 833517 141

title: W NIKE AIR RIFT BR
body_html:
The Air Rift was developed for Kenyan runners as a shoe that could mimic the feeling of running barefoot. With that kind of pedigree, it was always going to be one of Nike’s most unique efforts. The lightweight, open topped Air Rift is made even lighter thanks to a breathable, mesh upper.  The all-white colorway makes for a head turning summer shoe. You don’t have to be in contention for any world records to appreciate it.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

  • Women's Nike Air Rift BR
  • White/Pure Platinum 
  • 848386 100

title: NIKE ROSHE ONE
body_html:
The Roshe is only a few years old, but there are already countless variations and interpretations of it. It’s not difficult to understand why. The simple design makes it easy to adapt the Roshe to all the different materials and constructions while still maintaining the silhouette’s effortless, modern chic.

Sometimes, you really don’t need to add anything to the original. This Roshe features the standard nylon mesh upper construction, in a white on white colorway, on top of the distinctive, classic Roshe sole unit. This is exactly the modern elegance that launched the Roshe’s popularity into the stratosphere.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

Nike Roshe ONe
White/White
511881 112

title: X JUICE STAN SMITH
body_html:
Retail space Juice boasts locations in Asian metropolises like Hong Kong, Kuala Lumpur, Taipei, and Shanghai, making Juice a perfect collaborative partner for the Adidas Consortium World Tour.

Taking on the iconic Stan Smith is a bold move. Juice didn’t just take on the silhouette; they tackled the Stan Smith’s single most iconic form, the white and green tennis court classic. Generally, any alterations to such a timeless shoe are at risk for being deemed unnecessary, if not outright desecration.

Juice’s take on the Stan Smith makes subtle but effective changes. The green accents stay in place, but in a darker shade, while the white leather becomes soft, napped, grey suede. The shift from pristine athletic performance to confident, worn in style is one that perfectly encapsulate the shoe’s journey from tennis court to worldwide style icon.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: NIKE CORTEZ ULTRA QS
body_html:
The Nike Cortez has been continuously produced since 1972. The shoe’s classic, uncomplicated good looks have made it a perennial favorite, not exclusively amongst sneaker enthusiasts, but with a mass audience.

The success of the Cortez isn’t just a matter of nostalgia or reliability. The Cortez Ultra demonstrates just how timeless the silhouette really is. A lightweight synthetic upper and a sleek, black and gold makeover give a contemporary edge to one of the greatest casual shoes ever made.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out. 

  • Nike Cortez Ultra QS 
  • Black/Metallic Gold/Black
  • 882493 001

title: WMNS NIKE RIFT WRAP
body_html:
The original Air Rift is, like the Sock Racer, Presto, and Mayfly, an influential ancestor of the natural motion, Free Run movement. Inspired by barefoot, Kenyan runners (the Rift name was taken from a Kenyan province, and not the split toe design), the Air Rift’s minimalist yet progressive design turned a lot of heads. In an era dominated by heavily cushioned, tech silhouettes, the idea that this was a running shoe seemed absurd.

The design was remembered fondly as being unique, even by Nike’s standards, and the shoe’s enduring cult status led to a widespread rerelease last year.

For 2016, the Air Rift is the subject of a modern makeover. It seems odd to say that such a unique shoe has been updated, but NikeLab has taken the Air Rift sole unit and transformed a very specific running performance shoe into a minimalist must have for summer.

The exposed forefoot and straps have given way to a breathable, lightweight mesh, one piece upper. The redesigned upper wraps around the foot, hence the name.

Women's Nike Rift Wrap
Black/Black
853541 003

title: WMNS NIKE CORTEZ '72
body_html:
By now, you know the story of the Nike Cortez. Dates back to the days of Blue Ribbon Sports, where it was known as the Corsair, continuous production since 1972, Forrest Gump, etc.

Even without the shoe’s long history, it doesn’t necessarily need an elaborate build up. The simple good looks, especially in the classic white, red, and blue 1972 colorway, speak for themselves.

This edition pays subtle tribute to the timeless classic by rendering the original colorway in ultra-soft, premium leather.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out. 

  • Women's NIke Cortez '72
  • White/Varisty Red/Game Royal
  • 847126 101

title: AIR MAX 1 ROYAL
body_html:
Air Max day goes upscale with a NikeLab premium materials salute to the original Air Max 1.

The Air Max 1’s journey from revolutionary running shoe to global fashion icon has been the subject of countless retellings. The Air Max 1 has also been the subject of countless iterations. This isn’t the first time the shoe has been given a style oriented, non-traditional athletic make up, but it may be the most extreme expression of the approach.

The vivid royal blue and red color ways are in tune with the Air Max 1's active past, but a seamless, microsuede upper and vachetta leather accents give the Air Max 1 Royal a touch of genuine luxury, making it a fitting tribute to the shoe that has defined running style since 1987.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

Nike Air Max 1 Royal
Game Royal/GameRoyal/Summit White
847671 441

title: INSTAPUMP FURY OG
body_html:
The Instapump Fury was a radical, polarizing design, even before it hit store shelves. The notion of a running shoe that could be fine tuned, through the pump’s air system to suit the individual needs of a runner was radical enough itself, but what really made the Instapump Fury a legend was its looks. The fine tuned performance was one thing, but people who wouldn’t even run to catch a bus could still look at the Instapump Fury and be amazed.

Twenty-one years later, and the Instapump Fury is still turning heads. Even though its technological leaps have been more absorbed into mainstream thought, no one has ever come close to replicating the stand out look of this shoe.

The Instapump Fury may have been ahead of its time in 1994, but its ultra-modern, athletic looks are the it thing in style right now. This all-black Instapump Fury embraces its fashion side. The clean, minimalist approach allows the distinctive design qualities that made the shoe legendary to truly stand out.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: AIR GRIFFEY MAX 1
body_html:
Ken Griffey Jr. was, during the 90s, arguably baseball's biggest crossover star. There may have been players who could match Jr. in skills, and players plying their trade on better teams (though the mid-90s Mariners were, at their peak, a skilled and exciting side,) but all it took was the word Griffey, and even people with a passing familiarity with baseball would know exactly who you were talking about.

In 1996, Ken Griffey Jr was the recipient of a signature shoe from nike, a high top trainer (suitable for the artificial Kingdome turf) bearing his famous uniform number and the longtime blue and yellow livery of the Seattle Mariners.  

The electrifying superstar is set to be inducted into the baseball hall of fame this summer, so what better time than now to bring back this classic 90s design?

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

Nike Air Griffey Max 1
Varisty Royal/Black/White/Volt
354912 400

title: MCQ CELL MID WHITE
body_html:
The marriage of high fashion and athletic footwear has taken on a minimalist bent recently. The Cell Mid from Puma and Alexaander McQueen adds theatrical runway element.

The modern silhouette and neoprene sock liner provide the base of the Cell’s design, but the oversized tongue, strap supports, and a ratchet closure system that resembles a ski boot, the Cell Mid brings purely for show, bordering on impractical, but impeccably styled extravagance back to fashion house sneakers.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: TH SK8 NOMAD LX (LEATHER)
body_html:
Taka Hayashi’s collaborative work with Vans, whatever the theme ends up being, can always be counted on to deliver premium leather, craftsmanship, and detailing. The latest work from Hayashi and Vans Vault is no exception.

Two Vans bedrocks, the Slip On and the Sk8-Hi, feature two-tone leather uppers with laser cut, ornamental, perforated patterns. The shoes are released under the banner of ‘Nomad,” which showcases the pronounced, Native influence in Hayashi’s work.

The timeless, uncomplicated design that defines Vans makes shoes like the Slip on and the Sk8-Hi particularly well suited for Hayashi’s signature aesthetic. The Nomad collection strikes a fine balance between traditional walking footwear, casual fashion, and classic Vans. The Nomad name is exceptionally apt in this case. These are shoes that can travel from place to place, from situation to situation, and fit in perfectly.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

body_html:

title: STAN SMITH OG PK
body_html:
Classic meets contemporary on the Stan Smith OG Primeknit. The Stan Smith is the best selling Adidas model of all time, and the timeless white and green look is the shoe’s original, most iconic form.

We would call this untouchable, but Adidas has brought one of its most successful, modern innovations, Primeknit, to the table, to create a Stan Smith that offers both the enduring casual elegance of the original shoe with the sleek looks and comfort of modern, technological design.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: ZX FLUX ADV ASYM
body_html:
For a tech running concept that made its name in the 80s, the ZX series has made a remarkably seamless transition to a contemporary aesthetic thanks to the ZX Flux.

A lightweight, but snug fitting knit upper and an angled, asymmetrical lace up make the ZX Flux ADV Asymmetrical the most modern interpretation on the ZX name yet.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: NIKE FREE FLYKNIT MERCURIAL
body_html:
Nike’s Mercurial soccer boots are one of the sleekest products the company makes. They’d pretty much have to be; those 90 minutes demand a lot out of the feet, especially when you’re reliant on lethal speed and precision striking like notable Mercurial wearers Cristiano Ronaldo, Thierry Henry, Roberto Carlos, or Didier Drogba.

Unfortunately for the average fan, this style could only be admired from afar. Unlike, say, basketball or tennis, specialty soccer shoes aren’t an ideal candidate for fashion wear

The Nike Free Flyknit Mercurial translates the look of the on-pitch performance cleat for the streets, the terraces, and maybe even a less expensive patch of grass, if you’re feeling up for a spontaneous game.  

  • Nike Free Flyknit Mercurial
  • Black/Black/Dark Grey/Team Orange
  • 805554 008

title: NIKE AIR PRESTO
body_html:
The Air Presto is, unquestionably, one of the finest shoes of the modern era. It could be said that the Presto was the forerunner of the minimalist running shoe movement. The upper, consisting of just lightweight mesh and rubber support and the clothing letter sizing were nothing short of revolutionary. The minimalist, ultra-modern aesthetic of the shoe is still a striking stand out over a decade after the shoe’s original release.

The respective, monochrome all-black and all-white colorways on offer suit the Presto particularly well. The stark look trim away any remaining bit of extraneous fat that could possibly detract from the shoe’s silhouette.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

  • Nike Air Presto
  • White/White/Black
  • 848132 100

title: CT II LO
body_html:
Here is a random sampling of things that the Converse Chuck Taylor predates: the jet engine, both the Great Depression and the New Deal, prohibition, the Black Sox World Series scandal, Charlie Chaplin’s ‘The Kid,’ Superman, Mickey Mouse, F. Scott Fitzgerald’s ‘The Great Gatsby,’ and organized professional basketball itself.

The Chuck Taylor All-Star goes beyond over sales numbers (over a billion, but who’s counting), beyond legend and beyond icon. This shoe is a legitimate institution of American culture. The last changes made to the shoe’s design were those suggested by Chuck Taylor himself. Suffice to say that any changes made to this shoe would constitute a momentous occasion.

Now, we are clear on just how big a deal the CT II really is.

Don’t start working yourself up at the notion that a historic design has fallen under modernity’s heel. The essential design of the Chuck Taylor is the same. The changes come in the form of technological upgrades that improve the experience of wearing the shoe, and when a shoe is worn as ubiquitously as the Chuck Taylor is, that is a revolutionary step forward.

Minor tweaks come in the form of an ultra-soft, microsuede interior lining, and a padded tongue which prevents slippage. The major change comes in the form of cushioning. It’s not exactly a secret that the cushioning, or lack thereof, on the classic Chuck Taylor is considered a bug rather than a feature. The addition of Lunarlon technology to the sole addresses this need, while being physically light enough to not alter the fundamental structure of the shoe. So, let’s take the Chuck Taylor around the globe for another century. It will support you as much as you support it.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: VULC SLIP ON PW
body_html:
The Vulc Lace Up and the Vulc Slip on continue the sophisticated yet relaxed theme of Pharrell Williams’s current work for Adidas.

Maybe it’s the game’s gentlemanly background and country club wardrobe but there are no sports that exude an air of effortless refinement quite the way tennis does. So, a classic tennis silhouette with a vulcanized sole is the perfect base for any casual summer look.

The reliable, old-school pairing for a vulcanized sole is canvas. It’s timeless, and it works, but it’s been done. The Vulc updates the timeless lightweight upper/vulcanized sole formula. An elastic chambray upper with leather accents creates a light, free feel and an elegant, contemporary look.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: CT II LOW
body_html:
Here is a random sampling of things that the Converse Chuck Taylor predates: the jet engine, both the Great Depression and the New Deal, prohibition, the Black Sox World Series scandal, Charlie Chaplin’s ‘The Kid,’ Superman, Mickey Mouse, F. Scott Fitzgerald’s ‘The Great Gatsby,’ and organized professional basketball itself.

The Chuck Taylor All-Star goes beyond over sales numbers (over a billion, but who’s counting), beyond legend and beyond icon. This shoe is a legitimate institution of American culture. The last changes made to the shoe’s design were those suggested by Chuck Taylor himself. Suffice to say that any changes made to this shoe would constitute a momentous occasion.

Now, we are clear on just how big a deal the CT II really is.

Don’t start working yourself up at the notion that a historic design has fallen under modernity’s heel. The essential design of the Chuck Taylor is the same. The changes come in the form of technological upgrades that improve the experience of wearing the shoe, and when a shoe is worn as ubiquitously as the Chuck Taylor is, that is a revolutionary step forward.

Minor tweaks come in the form of an ultra-soft, microsuede interior lining, and a padded tongue which prevents slippage. The major change comes in the form of cushioning. It’s not exactly a secret that the cushioning, or lack thereof, on the classic Chuck Taylor is considered a bug rather than a feature. The addition of Lunarlon technology to the sole addresses this need, while being physically light enough to not alter the fundamental structure of the shoe. So, let’s take the Chuck Taylor around the globe for another century. It will support you as much as you support it.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: MRL696DE
body_html:
This version of a New Balance running classic is certainly a departure, but one that retains enough of what people love about the brand to keep it familiar. ‘Deconstructed’ is exactly the right word for this. The upper is pigskin suede that has no interior lining, like a moccasin. Visible stitching and a traditional New Balance sole unit provide contrast against the minimalist all black colorway.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: SAMOA VNTG
body_html:
In the dark ages, before the widespread release of retro sneaker models, there were a select few, old-school staples that were in continuous production. If you were buying from a regular sneaker source before the sneaker boom, your classic Adidas options were limited. The most commonly available were the Samba, Gazelle, Campus, Superstar, and the Samoa.

Like its esteemed peers, the chunky, soccer style trainer, particularly the extra thick toecap, cuts a timeless, distinctive figure. Considering all this, the Samoa would have to qualify as one of the most underrated silhouettes of all time. It’s possible that the usual leather make-up of the Samoa is dependable and consistently good looking, but easily overshadowed by flashier models.

Get ready to look at the Samoa in a whole new light. Adidas, in conjunction with Oyster Holdings founder Woodie White, presents the ‘Pigskin’ pack, a luxurious fashion upgrade for the venerable trainer.

Tonal colorways rendered in premium pigskin suede are an elegant reimagining, which brings the Samoa to the forefront of contemporary fashion, while staying in touch with the shoe’s sober upbringing.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

If the Air Huarache became a cult classic all those years ago in the first place, it’s because its fashion potential wasn’t fully appreciated by the sneaker buying public back then.

Now that the Huarache in the midst of overdue recognition on a mass scale, the Air Huarache Run Premium is very much about putting the fashion side of the Huarache to good use. The addition of a synthetic leather to the neoprene upper, in colorways with an eye towards the street rather than the track, means there is now a Huarache for every occasion.

title: NIKE W AIR MAX 1 ESSENTIAL
body_html:
The Air Max 1 is rightly considered to be one of the best looking and influential sneakers of all time. The most commonly cited feature is usually the revolutionary visible air window, but the Air Max 1 never really gets the credit it deserves for overall visual consistency. It’s difficult not to look at the pleasant, round silhouette and not get an overall sense of airiness.

The roundness of the Air Max 1 has another benefit. The soft features hold all that late 80s tech without appearing overly bulky, which makes the Air Max 1 readily adaptable to women’s fashion. The purple colorway on this model strikes a perfect balance between the running heritage of the shoe, and a casual-chic palette.

title: TUBULAR RADIAL
body_html:
When Adidas first developed the Tubular cushioning system in the mid 90s, it was ahead of its time. In fact, it was so far ahead of its time that it couldn’t be mass-produced efficiently, which would have made the retail price of the shoe astronomical. So, for many years, the idea was shelved.

Manufacturing has caught up to the Tubular technology, but that doesn’t mean the resulting footwear just slots right in, unnoticed, among all the other shoes on the market. Even by contemporary standards, the radical design of the Tubular range still turns heads.

The Tubular Radial is a streamlined offering from Adidas. The distinctive sole unit has been trimmed down, while the upper is a sleek neoprene with external support and lace structure.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: WMNS MAYFLY WOVEN
body_html:
The Nike Mayfly, in its original conception was, perhaps, the ultimate performance racing shoe. In the world of competitive running, “seconds count” is more than just a figure of speech, and when mere seconds can make the difference between victory and defeat, or coming just short of a new PR, any chance to shave them off your time is critical.

The Nike Mayfly sought to achieve this through weight reduction. The more weight a runner is carrying, the more effort has to be expended to achieve the same result. The Mayfly eliminated any extra baggage. The parachute nylon upper and minimalist sole were as light as possible. The idea was that wearing the Mayfly in a race after training in your every day shoes would make your normal effort that much more effective.

The original Mayfly’s innovation didn’t stop there. The shoe was designed to last over the course of 100 kilometers, which is why the shoe took its name from an insect with a 24-hour life cycle. Users were supposed to send the shoes back to Nike, where they would be recycled. That part didn’t quite work out as planned. Most people weren’t willing to part with the distinctive yellow and black, tree bark patterned Mayfly, planned obsolescence or not.

Now, the Mayfly is back in a form that the wearer is fully intended to keep for good. The shoe has been reimagined as a lifestyle silhouette. The sleek, minimal shape of the Mayfly is the same, but the lightweight nylon has given way to a woven, suede upper. Some things never change though. You’ll definitely want to keep these long after you’ve eclipsed the 100k mark.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

Nike Women's Mayfly Woven
Black/Dark Grey/White
833802 002

body_html:

So, what exactly is being said? How about that the Roshe is such a modern and functional, but timelessly stylish piece of design, that pairing it up with old-school legends like the LD-1000 is a natural fit.

A woven textile upper in a classic black and white colorway accentuates the timeless, casual style of a simple running silhouette.

title: NIKE ROSHE ONE HYPERFUSE BR
body_html:
The heart of the Roshe One is its simplicity; overt, technological add ons would be completely contrary to the spirit of the shoe. Options for boosting the standard model are, therefore, limited.

One way to put a new spin on the Roshe is by tweaking the upper. The Hyperfuse concept adds a tech factor that actually adds to the simplicity of the design. The one piece, seamless upper construction finds a way to decrease overall weight from a shoe that was incredibly light to begin with.

title: BWR ALL OVER LONGSLEEVE
body_html:
Los Angeles, more than most places, is prone to being described as having a dark or seamy underbelly. This is because of the permanent veneer of entertainment industry glamour that official L.A. presents to the world. This is the Los Angeles that attracts tourists and transients alike: the Los Angeles of ‘I Love L.A.,” red carpets, maps to the stars homes, the Brown Derby, and Hollywood and Vine.

Then, there’s the other L.A: the Los Angles of Suicidal Tendencies, N.W.A., Dogtown, and those geographical bywords for middle-American terror, East L.A. and South Central.

After the fact, the representatives of the respectable face of the city will be more than happy to claim these things as their own. Marketing jargon like “colorful local culture” will be employed, and the reputation of the city as a happening, exciting locale will be enhanced. The condemnation, harassment, and beatings that were doled out before these things became acceptable will be, conveniently, forgotten.

Born x Raised is the impulse to preserve the “other” Los Angeles in the face of the real estate and economic forces threatening to permanently alter the city’s cultural landscape. Born x Raised designs are inspired by some of the most uncompromising, confrontational elements of the various local subcultures, the kind of real life creative fire that has made the legacy of unofficial Los Angeles every bit as lasting and important as the Hollywood version.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: GRID SD
body_html:
One of the great things about a running shoe that stands the test of time to become a leisurewear staple is that when production is focused purely on aesthetics, the shoe can take on a new life, in materials that would have been wholly impractical before.

Case in point: the Saucony Grid SD. The split suede/nylon upper gives this running classic a luxurious feel to go along with its tech running history, while the perforations allow for breathability. The upper is broken up by split color-blocking with a white midsole.

title: CRAZY 97
body_html:
When Kobe Bryant started his legendary NBA career, his feet were clad in the three stripes. With Kobe’s final curtain call behind him, Adidas offers up a tribute to the Lakers icon that nicely bookends his career.

Kobe is most commonly known by his Black Mamba nickname, but in 2013, after a particularly impressive performance, a personal friend bestowed the moniker ‘Vino’ on Kobe, to signify that, like wine, the future hall of famer was improving with age.

Adidas uses this recent name to inform the design of a shoe from Kobe’s early career, the Crazy 97, which he wore upon first entering the league.

The Crazy 97 features a white colorway that pairs well with rich fish and white meat, cork detailing and wine label tongue graphics.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: STAN SMITH W
body_html:
There is very little to say about the Stan Smith that hasn’t already been said. It’s the best selling Adidas shoe of all time and it was the first ever leather tennis shoe.

The shoe is such an exemplary design that Stan Smith is actually the second name attached to it. The shoe was originally named for French tennis pro Robert Haillet, but his retirement left an endorsement vacancy. The shoe was already a success, and it wasn’t going anywhere any time soon, so Adidas secured the name of the current number one ranked player, Stan Smith, and the rest is history.

The Stan Smith has been produced in countless color and material variations, but this is the white leather, classic tennis model that started it all.

If a size is not listed , it is sold out.

title: NIKE AIR HUARACHE RUN ULTRA
body_html:
There just isn’t much more to say about the Huarache. Since Nike reintroduced the 1991-92 classic, people just can’t seem to get enough of it. So, what else is left?

That’s where the Air Huarache Ultra comes in. This new silhouette is a modernizing overhaul of the original. The familiar shape of the Huarache remains intact, as does the basic concept of the shoe, providing a lightweight, flexible runner that thanks to its snug, fitted construction, is fully supportive. The addition of the Flywire lacing system and an even lighter sole unit bring the Huarache into the modern running fold.

The Air Huarache Ultra combines a classic piece of design with contemporary technology. It’s the perfect reason to start collecting a whole new generation of Huaraches.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

  • Nike Air Huarache Run Ultra 
  • Blue Lagoon/White/Black
  • 819685 401

title: W NIKE JUVENATE WOVEN
body_html:
The Latin word for young, iuventus (juventus once the letter J was added to the alphabet) is the root for many modern words pertaining to youth and vitality. Although “Juvenate” is not strictly, a word, the Latin prefix tells the inquisitive sneaker enthusiast everything they would need to know about this shoe.

The Juvenate is the latest ultra light, modern, minimalist member of the Nike family, taking its place along side shoes like the Roshe, the Nike Free, and the Viritous. The Juvenate Woven wastes no time in exploiting the full fashion potential of this new silhouette. The multi-colored, crisscrossed woven upper brings a modish fashion touch to the modern athleisure movement.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: TUBULAR NOVA
body_html:
High fashion has become an entrenched fixture in the pop cultural landscape; not just in the sense of more people are aware of designers and labels, but that familiarity with the ins and outs of fashion has become mainstream. Basically, you can find kids engaged in some intense arguments over draping, and no one would bat an eye.

Before fashion was such a commonplace cultural element, its relationship with sneakers was purely tangential. Mostly, designer labels would release sneaker ‘inspired’ footwear that placed pricey labels on approximations of recognizable silhouettes. When Adidas originally embraced the idea and partnered with designers like Yohji Yamamoto and Stella McCartney, it was definitely a non-traditional step.

Now, the relationship between the two worlds goes beyond inspiration. Adidas is setting trends on their own, with the ultra modern, “athleisure” look that is helping to define contemporary style.

With the “Fashion Week” pack, Adidas takes a timeless classic in the Stan Smith and two futuristic runners in the Tubular Nova and Tubular Doom to the runway. Textured leather and reflective 3m uppers showcase the mix of aesthetics and athletics that have made the three stripes a leader in both fields.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: NIKE AIR MAX MERCURIAL R9
body_html:
Before Ronaldo referred to Cristiano, a player who didn’t need more than a single word for the world to know who he was held the mantle. Younger fans who may have only caught the tail end of his career might be unfamiliar with just how dominant the original Ronaldo was at his peak.

Before being ravaged by a devastating pair of knee injuries Ronaldo was the world’s most feared striker. The 1998 UEFA Cup final, where Ronaldo tormented fellow Serie A club Lazio, and an all time great defender in Alessandro Nesta in particular, stands as Il Fenomeno’s signature performance.

The Air Max Mercurial R9 is Nike’s tribute to the cleat that the lethal Brazilian wore while tallying up the majority of his 352 total career goals. The Mercurial’s transfer from grass to asphalt sees the cleats replaced by an Air Max sole unit, and a modernized, Hyperfuse upper.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.  

  • Nike Air Max Mercurial R9 
  • Black/Black/Reflect Silver
  • 818675 003

title: EQUIPMENT RUNNING SUPPORT
body_html:
In the past, Adidas has employed the oddity concept to some of its classic models to great effect. These vivid, color-clashing designs sprinted straight past bold into uncharted territory, and it worked.

The Adidas Equipment range is a different animal. The serious minded, high-tech, performance running shoes don’t necessarily lend themselves to a loud, multicolored interpretation. So, the oddity concept itself gets reimagined on this occasion.

Two classics from the performance line, the Equipment Running Support and a women’s Equipment 93 Racer feature a subdued, neutral heavy colorway, rendered in a seemingly incongruous variety of textured leather and suede.

Snakeskin, ostrich, cracked leather, and perforated nubuck come together to form the ‘Oddity Luxe,’ pack. “Luxe’ is a term ripe for some loose interpretations, but in this case, it is legitimately the perfect descriptor. The fashion forward but subtle aesthetic approach expertly translates the oddity ideal for the aggressive functionality of Adidas Equipment.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: GL 6000 SNE
body_html:
The original idea behind the GL 6000 was brilliantly simple. Apply the clean, simple design of the wildly successful Reebok Classic Leather casual silhouette to performance running shoe. The GL 6000 became a cult classic in its own right, and its mix of performance tech and timeless style have made it a perennial favorite among Reebok classics.  

When it comes to casual, it’s difficult to top summer days at the beach. With the ‘Summer in New England’ pack, Reebok offers a unique take on the summer beach vibe. New England beaches can tend to be a bit more visually subdued than the stereotypical white sand, crystal water, teal, white, coral look. The stony shores, darker waters, and cranberry bogs that define a significant part of the natural New England landscape are represented by red, navy, and grey color blocked suede. It’s an understated, classic New England take on a unique form of natural Oceanside beauty.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: ADILETTE CF+ C
body_html:
So many Adidas icons started off life as performance athletic footwear, but the Adilette sandal is a casual staple that is doing what it was built to do from day one, providing signature Adidas comfort to people enjoying a well-earned rest.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

The perennial appeal of classic New Balance runners lies in their aesthetic versatility. The tech elements and chunky silhouettes appeal to fans of classic performance shoes while the clean lines and stylish colorways appeal to retro running devotees.

The M9975GR is a made in the USA hybrid of the classic 997 and 998 models, in timeless, old-school grey.

title: CRAZY 8
body_html:
When Kobe Bryant started his legendary NBA career, his feet were clad in the three stripes. With Kobe’s final curtain call behind him, Adidas offers up a tribute to the Lakers icon that nicely bookends his career.

Kobe is most commonly known by his Black Mamba nickname, but in 2013, after a particularly impressive performance, a personal friend bestowed the moniker ‘Vino’ on Kobe, to signify that, like wine, the future hall of famer was improving with age.

Adidas uses this recent name to inform the design of two shoes from Kobe’s early career, the Top Ten 2000, which he wore upon first entering the league, and the Crazy 8 (formerly the KB 8,) Kobe’s first signature shoe.

Being wine themed, the shoes naturally are offered in red and white. The Top Ten 2000 features a white colorway that pairs well with rich fish and white meat, while the Crazy 8 is a rich, deep red merlot. Both colorways feature cork detailing and wine label tongue graphics.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: NPC UK TB
body_html:
The accent color on a classic white tennis shoe isn’t the kind of thing that immediately springs to mind as an aesthetic element that can change the complexion of a shoe, but in practice, it actually does make quite a difference.

The classic white and green colorway carries the casual air of a friendly game of tennis, perhaps an afternoon on the local court with nothing particular at stake. The psychological properties of green are said to be relaxing, harmonious, and non-aggressive, after all.

Blue also suggests a certain calmness, but an aloof, detached version of it. As it translates to the tennis court, blue is all business. The NPC UK Tennis Ball is a classic low-top tennis silhouette featuring a blue and white colorway, complete with old-school yellow tennis ball tongue detail that recalls the deadly efficient, wooden racket wielding court battlers of the 70s and 80s.

title: X BODEGA MOUNTAIN CUT
body_html:
Having a background in various subjects including, but not limited to, Chinese history, art history, ceramic production, ancient Eastern trade routes, and European social history is certainly useful when it comes to having an expansive understanding of the aura surrounding blue and white, pattered porcelain. But, people without a background in any of these subjects will at least be familiar with concepts like ‘Ming vase’ or ‘fine china’ being synonymous with fancy, old, and expensive (if not priceless.)

 

Chinese pottery had a longstanding tradition of exquisite beauty, long before it made its way to the west, but the arrival of the intricately patterned blue and white porcelain of Jingdezhen touched off a full-scale mania that would become a global phenomenon.

 

What made blue and white porcelain the object of such intense, consuming desire was its craftsmanship. The production process was, at the time it made its way to Europe, completely unique. A century or so and some noteworthy industrial espionage would lead to works of comparable quality eventually being produced on the continent, but as is so often the case, the original can never truly be matched.

 

In the world of sneakers, the ability to stand apart is a prized quality, especially as its popularity continues to expand. Boston’s Bodega and Amsterdam’s Filling Pieces are two entities that have successfully set themselves apart, thanks to a dedication to craft and a unique perspective.

 

The stitched leather and vulcanized rubber of the Mountain Cut may replace glazed and fired ceramic, but the essential point remains the same, having something beautiful that few if any other people can get their hands on just touches some kind of primal nerve in the human brain.

 

To that end, Filling Pieces x Bodega present a tribute to perhaps the original global hype craze with the most contemporary manifestation of it. The result: the blue and white porcelain sneaker.  Available in limited supplies, naturally.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

title: AIR GRIFFEY MAX 1
body_html:
Ken Griffey Jr. was, during the 90s, arguably baseball's biggest crossover star.   There may have been players who could match Jr. in skills, and players plying their trade on better teams (though the mid-90s Mariners were, at their peak, a skilled and exciting side,) but all it took was the word Griffey, and even people with a passing familiarity with baseball would know exactly who you were talking about.  

In 1996, Ken Griffey Jr was the recipient of a signature shoe from nike, a high top trainer (suitable for the artificial Kingdome turf) bearing his famous uniform number and the bold Pacific Northwest themed colors of the Mariners.  

The electrifying superstar is set to be inducted into the baseball hall of fame this summer, so what better time than now to bring back this classic 90s design?

title: NIKE AIR PRESTO ULTRA FLYKNIT
body_html:
It’s difficult to believe that the Air Presto is pushing twenty. Everything about the Presto concept from the futuristic design of the shoe, to the snug, sock liner fit to the alphabet sizing system, ranged from uncommon to practically unheard of. These elements added up to a revolutionary package, even by Nike’s innovative standards.

Sixteen years later, the Presto still looks as contemporary as the day it was released. Now that shoe design seems to have finally caught up to where the Presto was all those years ago, the shoe fits seamlessly into the line up of ultra-modern, minimalist footwear that’s flying off of shelves everywhere.

Fitting into the crowd just won’t do for the Presto. Nike has pushed the envelope on this modern icon the only way they could, by introducing advancements that have been made since the turn of the century.

A Flyknit upper maximizes the shoe’s original blend of lightweight comfort and a snug, supportive fit, while the mid-top construction lends a fashion forward, contemporary aesthetic.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.
